intro: Borreria dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This shrub typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky soils. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, elliptical fruits.
